# The `OptBisect` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class implements a mechanism to disable passes and individual optimizations at compile time based on a command line option (-opt-bisect-limit) in order to perform a bisecting search for optimization-related problems. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::OptBisect</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This class implements a mechanism to disable passes and individual optimizations at compile time based on a command line option (-opt-bisect-limit) in order to perform a bisecting search for optimization-related problems.

Definition at line 43 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h">OptBisect.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### OptBisect() {#af32e7aebb348a3e35c9cee4591bbf50e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="llvm::OptBisect::OptBisect ()"
  labels = {["default"]}>
Default constructor.

Initializes the state to &quot;disabled&quot;. The bisection will be enabled by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt</a> call-back when the command line option is processed. Clients should not instantiate this class directly. All access should go through <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llvmcontext">LLVMContext</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h/#l00050">50</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h">OptBisect.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### setLimit() {#a4ecc668238f31c2b642cdaecac4958e4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::OptBisect::setLimit (int Limit)"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set the new optimization limit and reset the counter.

Passing <a href="#a4620d3ae92a8d5408fd31221e3580bc3">OptBisect::Disabled</a> disables the limiting.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h/#l00072">72</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h">OptBisect.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### shouldRunPass() {#a0f286bb86d244482b2f03ac4f1943423}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool OptBisect::shouldRunPass (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> PassName, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> IRDescription)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Checks the bisect limit to determine if the specified pass should run.

The method prints the name of the pass, its assigned bisect number, and whether or not the pass will be executed. It returns true if the pass should run, i.e. if the bisect limit is set to -1 or has not yet been exceeded.

Most passes should not call this routine directly. Instead, it is called through helper routines provided by the base classes of the pass. For instance, function passes should call <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/functionpass/#af9f5f511d75e16f09a5520cb9444cfa8">FunctionPass::skipFunction()</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h/#l00064">64</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/optbisect-h">OptBisect.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/optbisect-cpp/#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/optbisect-cpp">OptBisect.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
